#!/bin/bash
# Check for Microsoft AutoUpdate
echo "Searching Microsoft AutoUpdate..."
if [ -d /Library/Application\ Support/Microsoft/MAU2.0/Microsoft\ AutoUpdate.app ] then exit 0 else exit 1 fi

#!/bin/bash #Description: For those that provision Microsoft apps via munki this is an attempt to prevent Microsoft AutoUpdate from constantly showing in the Dock #FYI: The command to undo all this foo is left commented at the end of the script in case you want to revert. #Quit Microsoft AutoUpdate pkill -x "Microsoft AutoUpdate" #Get the current user current_user=$(stat -f "%Su" /dev/console) #unload the LaunchAgent launchctl bootout gui/$(id -u "$current_user") /Library/LaunchAgents/com.microsoft.update.agent.plist #unload the LaunchDaemon launchctl bootout system /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.microsoft.autoupdate.helper.plist #delete the app #rm -rf /Library/Application\ Support/Microsoft/MAU2.0 #Prevent AutoUpdater to be re-installed # See https://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/428234/how-to-remove-microsoft-autoupdate-from-macos for F in /Library/{PrivilegedHelperTools,Launch{Agents,Daemons}}/com.microsoft.*update*.plist /Library/Application\ Support/Microsoft/MAU* ~/Library/Microsoft/*Updater; do echo 'Processing '"${F}"'..'; rm -rf "${F}" && mkdir "${F}" && chflags uchg "${F}"; done #The command to revert and allow AutoUpdate to be re-installed #for F in /Library/{PrivilegedHelperTools,Launch{Agents,Daemons}}/com.microsoft.*update*.plist /Library/Application\ Support/Microsoft/MAU* ~/Library/Microsoft/*Updater; do echo 'Processing '"${F}"'..'; sudo rm -rf "${F}"; done
